title: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials Teaching with Historic Places (TwHP) uses properties listed in the National Park Service's National Register of Historic Places to enliven history, social studies, geography, civics, and other subjects. TwHP has created a variety of products and activities that help teachers bring historic places into the classroom.  All Curriculum Materials   Lesson Plan    Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site: Monument to the Gilded Age Learn More     Field Trips For information about National Park Service school programs call Susanne Norris at 845-229-6873. To make a school group reservation call Kevin Thomas at 845-486-7751. All Field Trips   Field Trip    Guided Tour Learn More     Institutes & Field Schools Teaching the Hudson Valley (THV) helps educators discover, appreciate, and share the region's natural, historic, and cultural treasures with children and youth. THV fosters collaboration among schools, museums, parks, historic sites, art galleries, libraries, and other groups.  All Institutes & Field Schools   Institutes & Field Schools    Teaching The Hudson Valley Learn More
